newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Foxtel and Australis to merge - paper.
newsitem.headline: Foxtel and Australis to merge - paper.

text.p: The stakeholders in pay-television operators Foxtel and Australis Media have reached in-principle agreement to merge their operations, the Australian Financial Review (AFR) reported on Monday.
State-owned Telstra Corp Ltd and News Corp Ltd had agreed to sell their 100 percent interest in Foxtel in return for a combined majority stake in Australis, the newspaper said.
The backdoor listing of Foxtel still had to be cleared by Australis's bondholders and competition regulator the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC).
The ACCC vetoed a previous Australis/Foxtel merger proposal 18 months ago.
The AFR said the merger would be considered at a meeting of the Telstra board on Tuedsay.
A combined Australis/Foxtel would create a pay-television entity able to reach six million homes, compared with the 2.3 million homes reached by rival Optus Communications, it said.
